intro: Chrysocephalum squarrulosum var. brevifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
